intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Camilla, are you sure we shouldn't go straight home?

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Yes, silly Brother/Sister. Father wishes to meet with us here in Cyrkensia. It's his favorite town in all of Nestra.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But isn't it dangerous for Father to travel to a place like this?

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: It's fine. Father comes here often, and nothing bad has ever happened. Nestra is neutral territory, so you need not fear unless you try to start a fight.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh, I see. So we should all be safe here. That's a relief.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: It's always best to remain on guard. Stay on your toes, Corrin. This territory may be neutral, but there might be unruly Hoshidans about.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Leo!!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Long time no see, Brother/Sister.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm so happy to see you! Did you finish Father's mission already?

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: For the most part. All that's left is to guard Father during his time here. After that, I'm free to do as I please. That means I'll be joining you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Leo. I'll feel much better with you on our team.

intro.speaker: Odin
intro.line: Milord! You've finally arrived! I’ve been so worried... My mind has been spiraling intro a dark abyss ever since we parted!

intro.speaker: Niles
intro.line: It's nice to have you back. While you were doing the king's bidding we couldn't help but wonder what awful trials he was forcing you to endure. We've been terribly worried.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Whoa! This has gotten way too mushy way too fast!! I appreciate your concern, both of you, but give me some breathing room!

intro.speaker: Odin
intro.line: Heh, sorry...

intro.speaker: Niles
intro.line: As you wish, milord.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: If you are quite finished, Father should be here shortly. I'm expected to be at the theatre well before he arrives. If you'll excuse me...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The theatre? What theatre?

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Ah, that's right. This is your first time in the fair town of Cyrkensia. This place is known for its incredible singers and dancers. They always put on a big performance whenever Father comes to visit.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's interesting... Sounds exciting.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: If you're free, you should take the time to watch. It's sure to be breathtaking. Even warriors need to rest now and then. Just don't get carried away. Anyway, I really must be going. I'll catch up with you later!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Bye, Leo!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's so hard to put up a front when I'm still reeling from the tragedy in Cheve. As fun as it sounds, I'm in no mood for a show right now. Maybe Hans was lying. It's possible Father didn't really intend for us to... I'll ask him about it whenever I get the chance. I need to know. And if he did give the order, maybe I can convince him there's a better way.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow! THIS is Cyrkensia's opera house?! It's incredible...

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Corrin! Over here!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: There you are, Leo! I'm glad I finally found you. I've never seen such a huge crowd.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: It's something else, isn't it? You're just in time. Father arrived moments ago. Father... Corrin is here.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Corrin, I have received word about the incident in Cheve. I am told you eradicated the rebels, as well as the unarmed townspeople.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father, let me explain...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: You did well, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh?!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: When I heard that your group destroyed Cheve, I couldn't have been prouder. Rebellions are like seeds. One must salt the earth before they sprout. I knew you'd eventually come around and learn to accept my method of ruling. I'm told you even enjoyed watching the life spark fade from the injured rebel soldiers. Hans praised you highly for displaying behavior befitting a Nohrian royal.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But, Father... That's not true! Why would Hans say that?! I need to talk to you about what happened in Cheve. If you'll please allow me to–

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, the performance is about to begin. Please take your seat.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But–

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Such an important show cannot be delayed for one person, even a prince/princess. You can discuss your newfound Nohrian pride with King Garon later.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: What's wrong, Brother/Sister? Did something happen in Cheve?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, Leo... Something awful. But I suppose I'll have to discuss it with Father later.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Yes I'm afraid so. We can't keep the performers waiting. Your seat is right over there. Please hurry–it's about to begin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: OK, I'm going. I'll fill you in later, Leo.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh... It occurs to me I haven't seen Azura in a while. She would love to see this... I hope she found a seat elsewhere.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Embrace the dark you call a home, ♪ Gaze upon an empty, white throne...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Argh... Urgh...!!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: My king! What's wrong?! King Garon!! Soldiers! Capture that performer! Do it NOW! Her song may have been a curse of some kind...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: A curse?! Father...

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Corrin! Hurry, we need to catch that singer! Huh?! The stage... It's empty.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Did she get away?! Well, she couldn't have gotten far. Let's hurry!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Right!

intro.speaker: Kumagera
intro.line: Stop right there, Nohrians.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hoshidan soldiers?!

intro.speaker: Kumagera
intro.line: Back away if you wish to live. This war ends now... And the way to peace begins with the Nohrian king's death.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You intend to buy peace with death? That's madness!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: So the Hoshidans are responsible for that singer's curse. I should have known.

intro.speaker: Kumagera
intro.line: Singer? Curse? What are you rambling on about?

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Don't play dumb. One of your underlings performed a cursed song to hurt our father!

intro.speaker: Kumagera
intro.line: I have no idea what you're referring to, nor do I care. Leave it to a filthy Nohrian to fabricate a story to try and distract us.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: You're a liar and a coward! I won't let you get away with this!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Corrin, what's going on?!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura! Where have you been?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Sorry I'm late. I wasn't feeling well, so I went outside to get some air. Why are there Hoshidan soldiers here?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: They've come to kill Father. They used some strange song to incapacitate him. Oh! While you were outside, did you see a strange woman fleeing the opera house?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: ...No. I did not.

intro.speaker: Kumagera
intro.line: So you refuse to back down, eh? We'll just have to kill you all! Troops! Prepare to attack!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Dammit... We have no choice. We'll have to fight them off!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Let's do this.

battle.speaker: Keaton
battle.line: *sigh* I've made a real mess for myself. I came down the mountain to gather bugs for my collection, but now I'm lost... Hm? What's going on over there? I thought I heard a ruckus, but wow, that's a lot of people. Hmm... HMM... Ah! That guy/lady looks nice. I'll ask him/her for directions back up the mountain. I may have a horrible sense of direction, but I'm a great judge of character!

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Hey, you! Yeah, you with the sword and the hair and stuff!!

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: WHAA! Wh-why does that man have a tail?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Wow, really? That's really how you're gonna play this? I thought you looked like a nice guy/lady, but you clearly have issues... For the record, I am NOT a man with a tail. I'm a wolfskin, and proud of it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Wolfskin? Sorry, but what's that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Seriously? Have you been living in isolation your whole life or what?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Actually...

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: As a wolfskin, I can transform into a wolf by using a beaststone. Pretty killer, eh?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Wow, it really is! Sorry, I've lived a rather...sheltered life. I hope I didn't offend you. May I ask what you're doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Well, I'm sort of...just a bit...unsure of my whereabouts. I can't find my way home. I was thinking maybe...ya know...you could help a fella out?

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Ah, so that's why you called out to me. You're lost, poor thing.

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: No! No... I mean...maybe. I'm maybe just a little lost. but mostly not lost at all. It's complicated.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Sorry, but I actually don't know this area, much less the way back to your home.

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Oh, I see. well, whatever. I can manage on my own. I'll be fine...

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Wait! Why don't you join my team? You can stick with us until you find your way home. You seem like you'd be a great ally. What do you say?

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Join your group... Hmm... Well, I could find my way home anytime I wanted. Let's get that clear. But if you really think I'd be helpful, I can't very well turn you down.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Ha, your tail is wagging! Does that mean you're happy right now? Happy to join us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: My tail is NOT wagging! It's not! Got it?! Anyway, I guess it's settled. Nice to know ya! The name's Keaton. As a token of our new friendship, I'd like you to have this treasure I came across.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: It's a...hair ball...?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Keaton
recruit-talk.line: Heh heh, gorgeous, ain't it? Best one I've seen in ages. No need to thank me. As my new pal, I'm entrusting this gem to you. You better take good care of it, or else!

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Thanks... I'll do that.

boss.speaker: Kumagera
boss.line: We're not leaving until King Garon has met his maker. Stay out of our way!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: We somehow managed to win...but it seems that singer got away. Who even has the kind of power necessary to curse Father with a song?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: I don't know, but I intend to find out. She's most certainly with the Hoshidans. We'll all be in a world of hurt if she shows up again. She must be stopped.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm not convinced she was Hoshidan... I have a strange feeling that...

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Corrin!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Father? How are you feeling?

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: I'm fine, my son/daughter. I have a new task for you. Kill all of the singers in Nestra. Every last one of them.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: WHAT?! Y-you can't be serious! It was the Hoshidans who attacked us. The other performers are innocent!

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Foolish boy/girl. This is the only way to keep our royal family safe. Perhaps if you had caught the guilty party, the others could have been spared. But we must destroy anyone who might pose a threat to the Nohrian throne. As I said, rebellions are like seeds, and we must salt the earth before they sprout. You've seen many battles by now. Surely you've at least learned that much.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But Father! I won't—

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: Consider it done, my king.

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Leave it to us, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Iago, Hans. I look forward to hearing good news of Corrin's efforts.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Wait! Both of you! Father, I tried to bring this up earlier, but now it simply can't wait. You keep ordering me to take lives of innocent people. Why? If we showed mercy and tried to talk things out instead, no one would have to die. Even if we manage to win the war this way, people will lose faith in our kingdom. That's hardly even winning...

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Lose faith? Are you a princess or a saint, foolish child? After what you did in Cheve, I'm shocked to hear such a moralistic complaint.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's true... I didn't stop Hans in Cheve, as much as I wanted to. But what happened there tortures me, Father. It's no way to solve a conflict. Killing innocent people for our own benefit...for selfish glory and control... Is that really the Nohrian way? Is that really the legacy you wish to leave behind?!

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: You finally understand, though you still fight it. I desire only to rule Hoshido. I, and those who follow me, will do whatever it takes to achieve that. I don't care if the peons that fill our towns don’t trust us. They are nothing to me. Those who disobey will die. The rest will quickly learn.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Corrin, that's enough. Let's go. Father, Corrin is clearly exhausted from his/her travels and our recent battle. Please forgive his/her rude remarks. He/She doesn't truly feel that way.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's not true, Leo!

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: I said that's enough! Let's go. NOW.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: What were you thinking, challenging Father like that? Do you have a death wish?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, you heard the awful things he said. You don't agree with him...right? You can't agree that it's acceptable to kill innocent people for our own benefit!

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Of course I don't. Why do you think I helped you save Kaze and Rinkah? But just because we disagree doesn't mean we can openly disobey Father. If you do, one of these days he'll overreact a have you killed on the spot. Trust me, Brother/Sister. It's best to just stay silent and follow orders.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's what Camilla said...

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Your other siblings and I have been living under Father's thumb our whole lives. I am certain Xander and Elise would tell you the same thing.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I see. I know that's how you and the others have been forced to live all these years... I understand your perspective, but I simply can't carry out the orders Father just gave. I refuse to harm the innocent. All I want to do is protect them—to protect everyone.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Corrin, wait! Think about who you're talking to. You know me better than that. As I said, we must follow Father's orders...or at least appear to follow them.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Listen well. We may not be able to openly disobey him, but we're not powerless. Us royal siblings have made an art of appearing to be good little soldiers... All while secretly manipulating things for the better from behind the scenes. How do you think we've survived this long with our souls intact?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo... I'm impressed. But isn't it dangerous to go behind Father's back all the time?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Sometimes the righteous path is the most treacherous one to walk. Listen up. Start searching in unlikely places to give the performers time to escape. If our soldiers catch any of them, I'll step in and insist on killing them myself. I can't promise we'll be able to save them all, but that's the best I can do.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo... Thank you. I'm sorry I doubted you, even if just for a moment.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Heh, no worries. But don't think I'm doing this for you! You know how whiny Camilla and Elise get when you're unhappy. No one wants that. Besides, doing things like this is exciting. It's not like I'm a hero or anything.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Huh?! My Brynhildr is...glowing! And so is your Yato... What's going on?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Could it be? Is this the transformation the Rainbow Sage spoke of...? WHOA!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: The Yato has transformed! This must be the Grim Yato the rainbow Sage told me about.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Grim Yato... what are you talking about?! Did I miss something?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: In Notre Sagesse, I sought out the Rainbow Sage as Xander suggested. The Sage said I would soon join forces with another hero of Nohr... And when I did, that my Yato would evolve into the Grim Yato.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: The Sage said that? Incredible. Does that mean...I'm that Nohrian hero?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's the only explanation. There's some sort of otherworldly connection between our weapons. The sage also said my sword is fated to become the true Seal of Flames. That's all he was able to tell me.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: The Seal of Flames... I wish I had time to digest all this, but time is a luxury we don't have. Iago and Hans might have already captured some of the singers. I'll leave you here. Promise not to challenge Father while I'm gone. I mean that, Brother/Sister. Your life depends on it.
